abstract.en: This repository contains the data used to create AlphaFind (https://alphafind.fi.muni.cz/), a web-based search engine that allows for fast structure-based search of the entire set of AlphaFold DB protein structures. First, we include compact (dimensionality=45) vector embeddings for 214M protein structures from the AlphaFold database (https://alphafold.ebi.ac.uk/, available for download at https://github.com/google-deepmind/alphafold/tree/main/afdb). We used these embeddings for fast protein similarity searching, by quickly pre-filtering the candidate answer (214M → 1M structures). This is made possible by the grouping of proteins into 2000 similar clusters (the form in which the data is provided) using a classification neural network (provided as well). These compact vector embeddings as well as the grouping can be freely used and distributed and given the vector are suitable for processing by several data processing tools. For reproducing the results, see also our GitHub repository (https://github.com/Coda-Research-Group/AlphaFind) with open-sourced code.

abstract.cs:
Surová projekční data CT skenu dřevěného párátka s vysokým rozlišením. 
Sken byl proveden pomocí přístroje Rigaku nano3DX s kvazi-paralelním 
rentgenovým svazkem. Délka hrany pixelu v projekčních datech je 0.54 
mikrometru.
abstract.en: Raw projection data of a high-resolution CT scan of a wooden toothpick. The data were scanned on the Rigaku nano3DX with a quasi-parallel x-ray beam. The pixel edge length in the projection data is 0.54 micrometers.

abstract.en: Industry applications of duplex stainless steels require a two-phase microstructure with a nearly balanced austenite-ferrite content to achieve good mechanical properties and good corrosion resistance. The most widespread additive manufacturing method such as laser powder bed fusion provides nearly fully ferritic microstructures due to the very high cooling rate, and the post-processing heat treatment must be performed. In contrast, other additive manufacturing methods, such as directed deposition methods, reach lower cooling rates and enable to obtain an equal ferrite–austenite ratio directly in the microstructure of the as-built state. In this work, the super duplex stainless steel SAF 2507 was deposited by directed energy deposition. The process parameters, namely, the laser power, laser beam spot, and powder feed rate, were varied to investigate the impact of the energy area density on the microstructure and tensile properties. A decrease in the energy area density caused an increase in the austenite content of 48 vol% and a numerical simulation of the sample temperature distribution inside the block during deposition, explaining the relationship between the amount of in situ formed austenite and the deposition parameters, was provided. Simultaneously, the deposition rate increased by more than five times. In contrast, the samples deposited at a higher building rate are characterized by greater porosity and lower elongation values in the vertical direction. The effect of the deposition parameters on the yield strength is low.

abstract.en: Gold-silver synergism has been well documented in many scientific works dealing with luminescent nanostructures that are exploitable in biomedical and environmental application. Frequently, the ratio of Au : Ag in synthetic mixtures was varied to influence the extent of Au-Ag synergism of the resulting luminescent gold-silver nanoclusters (LGSN). However, in our approach, a new step, maturing under differing conditions using the same Au : Ag ratio (5 : 1), has been investigated systematically for the very first time. As referent systems, monometallic gold nanoclusters (AuNCs) and protein treated by the conditions of synthesis and maturing were prepared and investigated. The selected types of maturing conditions led to distinct changes in fluorescence characteristics and, consequently, Au-Ag synergism extent (evaluated as the ratio of fluorescence quantum yields (FQY) of GSNC vs. AuNCs). The best synergism was obtained for GSNC matured at 37°C for 2.5h. The stability of luminescent signal of these GSNC was tested in the presence of an excess (till 20 mM) of Cu (II) and/or Fe (III) ions (crucial cofactors in living systems). The same metallic ions concentration caused different extents of GSNC luminescence quenching, for which a plausible reasoning is suggested.

abstract.cs:
Cíle: Cílem výzkumu bylo objasnit vztahy mezi využívanou zdravotní péčí a její dostupností, přípravou na aktivní stáří a stárnutí a zapojení se do péče o své vlastní zdraví u osob ve věku 65 let a více.

Metodika:: Pro naplnění cíle byl využit kvalitativní výzkum (zakotvená teorie). Výzkum byl realizován od počátku února do konce dubna r. 2024. Informanty byly osoby ve věku 65 let a více, které žily v Jihočeském kraji. Bylo využito polostrukturovaných rozhovorů.

Výsledky: Jako centrální kategorie bylo identifikováno zdraví. Z dalších kategorií byly identifikovány: dostupnost péče, služby praktického lékaře, aktivní stáří, alternativní medicína a hospitalizace. Nalezené souvislosti ukazují, že je zdraví klíčem k naplnění myšlenky zdravého stáří a stárnutí, přičemž je v úzkém vztahu k soběstačnosti. Soběstačnost je přitom z pohledu aktivního stáří v očích informantů nezbytná. Jejímu udržení z pohledu plánování budoucnosti věnují pozornost. Nemoc je naopak faktorem ovlivňujícím úvahy o budoucnosti, o dostupnosti péče i o potřebě informací. Významným prvkem se tak stává i komunikace, která se celou koncepcí úspěšného stáří a stárnutí prolíná.

Závěr: Výsledky naznačují, že je v budoucnu nezbytné věnovat větší pozornost zkoumání očekávání pacientů a zdravotníků ohledně péče zaměřené na udržení a obnovení zdraví, případně na realizaci změn.

title.cs: Dataset for Polymerase Synthesis of Hypermodified DNA Displaying a Combination of Thiol, Hydroxyl, Carboxylate and Imidazole Functional Groups in the Major Groove

abstract.en: We designed and synthesized a set of six 2’-deoxyribonucleoside 5’-O-triphosphates (dNTPs) bearing functional groups mimicking amino acid side chains in enzyme active sites (OH, SH, COOH and imidazole) attached to position 5 of pyrimidines or position 7 of 7-deazapurines through different linkers. These modified dNTPs were studied as substrates in enzymatic synthesis of modified and hypermodified DNA using several DNA polymerases. In primer extension (PEX), all modified dNTPs provided DNA containing one, two, three, or (all) four modified nucleotides each bearing a different modification, although the thiol-modified dNTPs were worse substrates compared to the others. In PCR, we observed exponential amplification for any combination of one, two or three non-sulfur dNTPs but the thiol-modified dNTP did not work well in any combinations. Sequencing of the hypermodified DNA confirmed the good fidelity of the incorporation of all the modified nucleotides. This set of modified dNTPs extends the portfolio of building blocks for prospective use in selections of functional nucleic acids.

title.cs: Dataset for Polymerase Synthesis of Hypermodified DNA Displaying a Combination of Thiol, Hydroxyl, Carboxylate and Imidazole Functional Groups in the Major Groove (ver. 2)

abstract.en: A new enzymatic method for truncation of aptamers from 5’-end has been developed and demonstrated on a newly selected indole-modified β-conglutin aptamer. This method relies on extension of a primer containing ribonucleotides, which can be specifically hydrolyzed by RNase, thereby removing the whole or 5’-part of the primer. This approach enables flexible synthesis of modified aptamers truncated from the 5' end, 3' end, or both ends - a capability previously achievable only through chemical oligonucleotide synthesis. Furthermore, by employing doubly labeled primers, diverse labeled or modified nucleotides can be introduced to prepare 5’-labeled aptamers suitable for fluorescence- or immobilization-based assays. The different variations of this method also enable the synthesis of mutated sequences to study the effect of modifications and their positions. Overall, this enzymatic method provides a valuable alternative for the truncation or labeling of (hyper)modified and functional oligonucleotides avoiding the need for chemical synthesis.

abstract.cs:
Databáze se skládá ze tří data setů představující hranice a jádra
sociogeografických regionů v roce 2021, vymezených metodikou prof. Hampla na
základě dat o dojížďce ze Sčítání lidu, domů a bytů. Databáze se skládá ze tří
datasetů určujících: (1) mikroregiony; (2) makroregiony; (3) regionální jádra.

abstract.cs: Nádorová onemocnění představují druhou nejčastější příčinu úmrtí v České republice. Na tomto stavu se významně podílí řada rizikových faktorů a neuspokojivá míra zdravotní gramotnosti v této oblasti. Cílem příspěvku je poukázat na současný stav informovanosti a zájmu o preventivní činnosti v souvislosti s nádorovými chorobami mezi českou populací ve věku 18+ a poukázat na úroveň znalostí o prevenci nádorových onemocnění. V rámci empirického šetření bylo využito kvantitativního šetření za pomoci elektronického dotazníku vlastní konstrukce, který čítal 35 otázek. Dotazníkové šetření probíhalo od 16.1. do 14.2. 2025. Výzkumný soubor čítal 180 osob ve věku 18+. Získaná data byla zpracována v programu MS Office Excel. Výsledky poukazují na to, že znalosti české populace ve věku 18+ jsou v oblasti prevence nádorových onemocnění nevyvážené. S rostoucí úrovní dosaženého vzdělání roste i úroveň znalostí. Vyšší zájem o prevenci v této oblasti vykazují ženy. S rostoucím věkem respondentů pak klesá zájem o prevenci. Výraznější nedostatky ve znalostech se objevují v oblasti screeningových programů a ve znalostech spojených s frekvencí preventivních vyšetření. Naše zjištění poukazují na nezbytnost opakované edukace a rozvoje vzdělávacích aktivit, které pomohou zvýšit povědomí o důležitosti prevence nádorových onemocnění. Zároveň poukazují na nezbytnost efektivní a opakované edukace i ve vyšších věkových kategoriích, kde může být riziko vzniku některých nádorových onemocnění výraznější.
abstract.en: Cancer is the second most common cause of death in the Czech Republic. A number of risk factors and an unsatisfactory level of health literacy in this area significantly contribute to this situation. The aim of the contribution is to point out the current state of awareness and interest in preventive activities in connection with cancer among the Czech population aged 18+ and to point out the level of knowledge about cancer prevention. As part of the empirical investigation, a quantitative survey was used using an electronic questionnaire of our own design, which included 35 questions. The questionnaire survey was conducted from January 16 to February 14, 2025. The research group included 180 people aged 18+. The obtained data were processed in MS Office Excel. The results indicate that the knowledge of the Czech population aged 18+ is unbalanced in the field of cancer prevention. With an increasing level of education, the level of knowledge also increases. Women show a higher interest in prevention in this area. As the respondents age, interest in prevention decreases. More significant gaps in knowledge appear in the area of ​​screening programs and in knowledge related to the frequency of preventive examinations. Our findings point to the necessity of repeated education and the development of educational activities that will help increase awareness of the importance of cancer prevention. At the same time, they point to the necessity of effective and repeated education also in older age categories, where the risk of developing some cancers may be more significant.

abstract.cs:
Cílem výzkumu bylo popsat úroveň zdravotní gramotnosti u seniorů Jihočeského kraje ve vztahu k depresi.  Zdravotní gramotnost lze sledovat v oblasti zdravotní péče, prevence nemocí a podpory zdraví.

Metody: Výzkum byl realizován prostřednictvím kvantitativní výzkumné strategie pomocí řízeného rozhovoru. Výzkum byl koncipován jako sociologický. Struktura rozhovoru byla odvozena od standardizovaného dotazníku HLS-EU-Q16, doplněného o otázek sociodemografického charakteru, a hodnocení subjektivního zdravotního stavu a zdravotního chování. Celkem bylo osloveno 403 jedinců vybraných kvótním výběrem, Z hlediska pohlaví tvoří soubor 43,7% mužů a 56,3% žen, ve věku 65- 74 let bylo 57,9% respondentů, ve věku 75 –84let -32,9%, ve věku 85 a více let- 9% respondentů.  

Výsledky: Úroveň zdravotní gramotnosti u seniorů Jihočeského kraje ve věku 65 a více let byla u 9% jako dostatečná, u 24,1% dotazovaných problematická, a u 16,1% dotázaných byla zjištěna neadekvátní (nedostatečná) zdravotní gramotnost. Úroveň zdravotní gramotnosti roste s úrovní nejvyššího dosaženého vzdělání. U seniorů, u kterých byla naměřena neadekvátní zdravotní gramotnost, ve významně větší míře trpí mírnou depresí.

Závěr: V budoucnosti by se měla výzkumná šetření zaměřit na roli nízké zdravotní gramotnosti u osob trpící depresí.
abstract.en:
Objective: The research aimed to describe the level of health literacy among seniors in the South Bohemian Region aged 65+ about depression.
Design: descriptive and cross-sectional
Participants: 403 individuals selected by quota sampling were included in the study. The sample is representative in terms of gender, age, and region.

Methods: The interview structure was derived from the standardized questionnaire HLS-EU-Q16, supplemented by socio-demographic questions.

Results: The level of health literacy among seniors was considered sufficient for 59.9%, problematic for 24.1% of respondents, and inadequate (insufficient) health literacy was found for 16.1% of respondents. Seniors who were measured to have inadequate health literacy were found to suffer from mild depression to a significantly great extent.

Conclusion: Research should focus on the role of low health literacy in people suffering from depression.

abstract.en: Introduction:Ischemic heart disease is one of heart and vascular  diseases caused by atherosclerosis. Healthy lifestyle remains to be the main preventive intervention.It needs to be reminded that the complex process of patient education develops the patient`s knowledge, skills and attitudes.Objective:to describe the state of education in the prevention of modifiable  risk factors of cardiovascular diseases (further CVD) from the point of view of patients.Methods: A non-standardized questionnaire relating to the ischemic heart disease was used for the data collection. The sample of respondents was chosen using a quota selection corresponding with the composition of all CR citizens with in terms of regions, sex and age. The total sample consisted of 1,391 respondents. Results:The results showed a significant correlation between gender and the education on exercise (p=0.001). Furthermore, a significant correlation was identified between sex and the education on smoking (p=0.001).A significant correlation was identified between sex alcohol abusing (p=0.001).In respect of the age, nurses most participate in the education on nutrition, (p=0.001), cessation of smoking (p=0.001). Furthermore, the study proved that the motivation elements in the education on modifiable risk factors were not sufficiently used. 47.5% of respondents answered that nurses used open-ended questions in the education, 37.3% of respondents meant that nurses always and often used reflection. Conclusion:Shortcomings were identified relating to the low use of motivation elements. Therefore, it can be judged that in practice, the education has just an informative character.(en),

abstract.en:
This dataset supports the publication "Complete Workflow for Detailed 3D Forest Reconstruction: From Terrestrial Laser Scanning to Complex 3D Radiative Transfer Modelling". It contains terrestrial laser scanning (TLS) point clouds, real airborne laser scanning (ALS) data, and simulated ALS datasets generated using the Helios++ ray tracing engine. The dataset covers four forest plots located in the Silesian Beskids, Czech Republic, representing mixed broadleaf and coniferous stands.

The TLS data were used to reconstruct biologically realistic 3D tree models, including wood and foliage, using a custom-trained PointNet++ classifier and quantitative structure models (QSMs). The Simulated ALS point clouds were produced by scanning these reconstructed plots virtually, under conditions matching real flight parameters. The Real ALS data provide reference observations acquired under leaf-on canopy conditions in July 2019 using a RIEGL LMS-Q780 sensor.

All data are spatially referenced, pre-processed (e.g., height normalisation, classification), and formatted as .laz files. This dataset enables the validation of virtual laser scanning outputs against real-world observations and supports further research in forest structure analysis, radiative transfer modelling, and synthetic remote sensing dataset generation.

abstract.en:
This repository contains compact (d=45) protein structure vector embeddings for 214M protein structures from the AlphaFold database (https://alphafold.ebi.ac.uk/), version 3 (raw data ↗️ made available by Deepmind in July, 2022). We used these embeddings to significantly reduce the search time in our AlphaFind web-based similarity search tool, designed to allow for fast protein similarity searching, by quickly pre-filtering the candidate answer (214M → 1M structures). This is made possible by the grouping of proteins into 2000 similar clusters (also a part of this dataset) using a classification neural network.

These compact vector embeddings as well as the grouping can be freely used and distributed and given the vector are suitable for processing by several data processing tools.

abstract.en: The dataset consists of the video records of the rainbow trout in three cultivation units infected by Red mark syndrome disease (RMS). The videos were recorded by the digital camera placed in the cultivation tank's waterproof box. Each video is 30 minutes long. The records were taken during 3 months. Two tanks, TANK_01 and TANK_03 contain infected fish. TANK_20 contains control non-infected fish. The dataset documents the progress of the RMS visible signs on the fish skin from early to late stages. The dataset was used to develop a remote early warning system for automatic disease detection in aquaculture production. It can be used for the studies in the filed of automation of aquaculture: fish individual identification, disease analysis, fish behavior analysis, or fish detection.

abstract.cs: Datový balíček obsahuje anonymizované přepisy 15 polo-strukturovaných rozhovorů s odsouzenými muži ve věznici s ostrahou v ČR, nasbírané v letech 2018–2019. Transkripty vznikly z audiozáznamů, prošly jazykovou normalizací, pseudonymizací (v1) a úplnou anonymizací (v3; k-anonymita ≥ 5). Součástí jsou metadata (codebook, DMP, etický protokol) a popis anonymizačního schématu (přezdívky, zobecnění míst a institucí). Formáty: .rtf (transkripty), .csv/.pdf (metadata). Témata rozhovorů pokrývají každodenní režim, práci a samosprávu na oddílech, vztahy mezi vězni a zaměstnanci, drogovou scénu, kázeňská opatření a prožívání trestu. Z důvodu plánu doktorského studia, které počítá s dokončením disertační práce a dvěma souběžnými články v roce 2027 si vyhrazuji právo data prozatím nezveřejňovat. Po skončení embarga budou data dostupná pro sekundární kvalitativní analýzy; veřejná verze neobsahuje osobní údaje.

abstract.en: It is well known that urban areas have an effect on relevant meteorological variables such as temperature and wind speed, but the effect on cloud cover and precipitation is less study. To assess this impact, we use the WRF model over a domain covering Central Europe. Here we present the results obtained from a 15-members ensemble to quantify the impact of urban areas on temperature at 2 m (T2), specific humidity (Q2), cloud cover (CLDFRA_comp) and hourly precipitation (hourly_prec) over Central Europe from 2008 to 2017. These data are the basis for the analysis presented in the paper “Long-term impact of urban areas on meteorological conditions over Central Europe” by Villalba-Pradas, A., Karlický, J., Huszár, P., Žak, M., and Halenka, T.,  Annals of the New York Academy of Science, 2025  (check for final published version).

abstract.en: This dataset contains relevant raw data for the publication such as NMR and IR spectra, and results of DFT calculations. The dinuclear title compound [(Cp2Zr)2(μ-Me)(μ-C2Ph)] 5 was prepared from a zirconocene alkynyl methyl complex and Rosenthal’s zirconocene source [Cp2Zr(py)(η2-Me3SiC2SiMe3)] in a formal comproportionation reaction. This complex shows catalytic activity for the dehydrocoupling of amine boranes, with a dinuclear hydride-bridged alkynyl complex 6 being formed as a catalytically relevant species. The structure of this complex was confirmed for the first time by single-crystal X-ray analysis. The reaction of complex 5 with hydrogen results in hydrogenation of the alkynyl ligand, yielding a highly labile trinuclear hydride-bridged complex as a possible intermediate of zirconocene dihydride/ethylbenzene formation. This complex shows an unusual distorted planar tetracoordinate environment at the central carbon atom positioned between the three Zr centers. The reaction of complex 5 with 2-cyanopyridine and acetonitrile is characterized by a reduction of the substrates. The herein reported reactivity of complex 5 demonstrates the remarkable potential of well-established dinuclear zirconocenes to stabilize unusual bond situations, which were analyzed comprehensively using spectroscopic, structural, and computational methods.

_files.key: Data for Staining Tissues with Basic Blue 7 A New Dual Polarity Matrix for MALDI Mass Spectrometry Imaging.rar
_files.name: Data for Staining Tissues with Basic Blue 7 A New Dual Polarity Matrix for MALDI Mass Spectrometry Imaging.rar

abstract.en: Obtaining high-quality matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry (MALDI MS) images and the reproducibility of the technique depend strongly on the sample preparation protocol. The most crucial part is the application of the MALDI matrix, which often relies on expensive spraying or sublimation coaters. In this work, we present a new dual-polarity matrix for MALDI mass spectrometry imaging (MSI): Basic Blue 7 (BB7), which belongs to the group of triarylmethane dyes. Thanks to its good solubility in water, this matrix allows a quick and simple sample preparation protocol without the need for sophisticated spraying or sublimation instrumentation: dipping the glass with tissue into the dye solution. This technique closely resembles the staining methods employed in classical histopathology. The technique is demonstrated on MSI of lipids in mouse brain sections in positive and negative ion modes using a subatmospheric pressure MALDI source coupled with an orbital trap mass spectrometer. The results are compared with traditional matrices, such as 2,5-dihydroxybenzoic acid (DHB) and 1,5-diaminonaphthalene (DAN). BB7 excels, especially in negative ion mode, offering low background signals and high signal intensities of many lipid classes. Furthermore, the stained tissue can simply be inspected visually and allows basic histopathology annotation prior to MSI. Here, we demonstrate that staining offers excellent image quality, reproducible sample preparation, and the potential for automation and utilization for high spatial resolution MSI.

abstract.en: The voltammetric behavior of the triazole fungicide triticonazole (TTC) was investigated for the first time using a boron-doped diamond electrode (BDDE). TTC provides several current responses on BDDE. An irreversible first anodic peak was observed at a potential of +1.5 V (vs. Ag/AgCl/KCl, sat.), while a second indistinctive oxidation peak was observed at approximately +2.0 V in the supporting electrolyte current onset, and a reduction peak was observed at a potential of 0 V. The mechanism of TTC oxidation was proposed and supported by theoretical calculations, electrochemical measurements, and the exhaustive electrolysis accompanied with product analysis using liquid chromatography with mass spectrometry (LC/MS). Subsequently, a voltammetric method for the determination of the fungicide was developed, employing square-wave voltammetry. This method exhibited a low limit of detection (0.125 µmol L-1), a broad linear dynamic range (0.5-20 µmol L-1), and excellent recovery in the analysis of pesticide preparations. Considering the low concentrations of TTC in natural waters, a sample pre-concentration technique using solid phase extraction was developed for these applications. The novel method was successfully transferred to screen-printed sensors with BDD electrodes (SP/BDDE). The obtained results indicate that SP/BDDE enable an expansion of the linear dynamic range (0.25-60 µmol L-1) of the proposed method. SP/BDDEs were successfully applied in the analysis of pesticide formulations and demonstrated 1.68 to 1.85 times better sensitivity.

abstract.en: The inter leaflet transport of phospholipids is a crucial physiological process that takes place in the cell plasma membrane. This process can be facilitated by specific proteins – scramblases – without the consumption of ATP. Experimental data, provided here, describe the  lipid scrambling activity of the Sec61/TRAP translocon. Sec61/TRAP has previously been described as a protein complex that maintainins the membrane transition of the nascent amino acid chain. In our work, we reconstituted Sec61/TRAP into large unilamellar vesicles and used experiments based on NBD fluorescence quenching by sodium dithionite or bovine serum albumin to investigate the scrambling activity of Sec61/TRAP. Both complementary approaches demonstrated lipid scrambling. Blocking the Sec61 translocation cavity did not affect scrambling, supporting the existence of an alternative scrambling pathway in the translocon complex.

abstract.en: This dataset presents the kinetics of calcein leakage from large unilamellar vesicles (POPC/POPE/TOCL 43/36/21) subjected to oxidative stress in the presence of the protein BAX and its activator cBid. Oxidative stress was mimicked by substituting 10 or 20 mol% of POPC with its oxidized derivatives PazePC or PoxnoPC. The BAX concentration ranged from 9 nM to 4.4 µM, while the BAX/cBid ratio was kept constant at 5:1.

abstract.en: The dataset comprises 3.5 million unique combinations of leaf biochemical properties and canopy structural characteristics of forest scenes, along with various configurations of solar geometry. It provides spectral data spanning wavelengths from 450 nm to 2300 nm, with a 2 nm resolution. The dataset is divided into two files: one detailing the average reflectance of all scene pixels and another focusing specifically on sunlit leaf pixels. Look-up tables (LUT) were created using version 5.10.0 of the Discrete Anisotropic Radiative Transfer model. The virtual forest scenes are based on 3D models of European beech trees, derived from Terrestrial Lidar Scanning, and adjusted for different leaf area indices and structural configurations to simulate natural forest diversity. Reflectance data were processed using Matlab and Python scripts, resulting in hyperspectral cubes, which were subsequently used to generate the LUT. This dataset is valuable for training machine learning models aimed at retrieving forest functional traits and for calibrating remote sensing algorithms. Its high spectral resolution and diverse trait combinations make it adaptable to different times, locations, and both hyper- and multispectral sensors, supporting future hyperspectral satellite missions.

abstract.en: This dataset supports the published article " Tuning of MoS2 Photoluminescence in Heterostructures with CrSBr."  In this work, we present a method for modulating the photoluminescence (PL) of monolayer (1L) MoS2 through its interaction with the semiconductor CrSBr. We find that CrSBr layers up to 18 nm thick enhance MoS2 PL, while thicker flakes tend to quench it. This behavior is attributed to an n- to p-doping transition in MoS2, driven by charge transfer in a type-II band alignment. Our findings are supported by first-principles calculations, transport measurements, Kelvin probe force microscopy, and time-resolved PL spectroscopy. Additionally, we fabricate a lateral CrSBr/MoS2 photodetector operating in the AC regime, achieving a responsivity of 105 A/W.

abstract.en: The development of elastic nanostructured Si-based anodes holds promise for advancing lithium-ion batteries due to the high theoretical specific capacity exhibited by Si. Combining nanostructured Si with C proves to be a successful strategy in addressing the challenges tied to the substantial volume expansion of Si during lithiation. In this work, a novel Si-based anode is fashioned through a simple and universal strategy, integrating Si nanoparticles with 1D nano-carbonaceous fillers (CPPy-NT) featuring nanotubular morphology and N atoms, and a water-based binder (poly(acrylic acid)). CPPy-NT are derived by carbonizing pre-synthesized polypyrrole nanotubes (PPy-NT). A clear correlation is established among the carbonization temperature for CPPy-NT preparation, N content in CPPy-NT, electrical conductivity, and the electrochemical performance of the ensuing Si/CPPy-NT anode. For comparative analysis, the electrochemical properties of the Si-based anode employing Super P (commercial carbon black) or PPy-NT are contrasted with those of Si/CPPy-NT. Notably, the Si/CPPy-NT anode with CPPy-NT bearing the highest amount of graphitic N sites exhibits a substantial improvement in initial charge capacity (approximately 2200 mAh g−1) and enhanced cycling stability. These findings underscore the potential to elevate the electrochemical activity of the C filler by carefully optimizing morphology, conductivity, and the incorporation of an appropriate amount of graphitic N.

abstract.en: Protein-RNA interactions play important biological roles and hence reactive RNA probes for cross-linking with proteins are important tools in their identification and study. To this end, we designed and synthesized 5′-O-triphosphates bearing a reactive squaramate group attached to position 5 of cytidine or position 7 of 7-deazaadenosine and used them as substrates for polymerase synthesis of modified RNA. In vitro transcription with T7 RNA polymerase or primer extension using TGK polymerase was used for synthesis of squaramate-modified RNA probes which underwent covalent bioconjugations with amine-linked fluorophore and lysine-containing peptides and proteins including several viral RNA polymerases or HIV reverse transcriptase. Inhibition of RNA-depending RNA polymerases from Japanese Encephalitis virus was observed through formation of covalent cross-link which was partially identified by MS/MS analysis. Thus, the squaramate-linked NTP analogs are useful building blocks for the synthesis of reactive RNA probes for bioconjugations with primary amines and cross-linking with lysine residues.

abstract.en:
The stored dataset characterizes the application of hollow fiber-based liquid phase microextraction (HF-LPME) for the voltammetric determination of the antihypertensive drug lercanidipine (LCN) in distilled water, urine, blood plasma, and blood serum using screen-printed boron-doped diamond electrodes (SP-BDDE). 
The dataset contains the results of the investigation of the optimum conditions for the voltammetric determination of LCN using SP-BDDE in distilled water. It also includes the investigation of the optimal conditions for LCN HF-LPME (donor phase, acceptor phase, pH, ionic strength, solvents, stirring, extraction time, etc.). It also contains the results (calibration curves) of the LCN determination using HF-LPME and SP-BDDE in distilled water, urine, blood plasma, and serum.

abstract.en: The dataset contains hdEEG records of 15 subjects after excluding poor-quality records. Three records for each subject were recorded during the ASSR experiment, first with headphones stimulation, second with speakers stimulation, and third with speakers stimulation and distinctive muscle artifacts. The subjects were males and females, between the ages of 25 and 46. All the subjects were right-handed without any known neuropsychiatric diseases or hearing impairment. The experiment was conducted in accordance with the Helsinki Declaration of Human Rights. The ethical committee of the National Institute of Mental Health (Klecany, Czechia) approved the study. Each subject was, before recording, instructed about the risks and the measurement procedure and signed informed consent.

abstract.en: This dataset shows the calcium influx of GCaMPfu transfected Jurkat cells interacting with a surface that mimics microvilli and is functionalized with biotinylated anti-human CD3ε (MEM-57). The cells were imaged using TIRF microscopy and saved in .tif files. The data shows the first contact of the cell to the surface and the calcium dynamics in single cells. The raw data can be analysed quantitatively by examining the fluorescence produced by each cell.

abstract.en: The dataset contains negative ion mass spectra of naphthalene, phenanthrene and anthracene clusters both with and without doping with O2 and CO2 molecules. Investigating such systems is important in order to more thoroughly understand how the properties of the constituents (e.g electron affinity) affect fundamental processes relevant from the astrochemical point of view.

abstract.en: The dataset captures an evolution of a small flare that peaked on 18 July 2022 at around 14.00 UT. The observations were made using a full-disc telescope of the Solar Patrol service, Astronomical Institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences in H-alpha line. The dataset consists of 760 frames spanning from 13.57 UT to 14.09 UT with an average cadence of about 1 frame per second. The dataset was coaligned (solar north is up), all the necessary metadata respecting the Solarnet convention are available within headers of the individual FITS files. A short overview video is also available.

abstract.en:
The dataset contains the inputs for DMRG calculations, outputs, reduced density matrices and the quantum information measures.
Orbital entropies, pair entropies, and mutual information have become popular tools for analysis of strongly correlated wave functions.
They can quantitatively measure how strongly an orbital (e.g. from the DMRG active space) participates in the strong correlation
and reveal the correlation pattern between different orbitals.
However, this pattern can become rather complicated and sometimes difficult to interpret for large active spaces
and is not invariant with respect to the spin projection ($M_s$) component of the spin multiplet state.
We introduce a modified spin-free orbital entropy, pair entropy, and mutual information, which  simplify the correlation analysis and are invariant with respect to $M_s$.
By comparison of these quantities with their ``original'' spin-including counterparts
one can distinguish static correlation due to spin couplings from the ``genuine'' strong correlation  due to a multiconfigurational character of the wave function.
We illustrate the approach on a model consisting of a non-interacting dimer of triplet diradicals and
on a more realistic example of iron-sulfur bound complexes with one and two iron atoms.

abstract.en:
Heavy atom compounds represent a challenge for computational
chemistry due to the need for simultaneous treatment of relativistic and correlation
effects. Often such systems also exhibit strong correlation, which hampers the
application of perturbation theory or single-reference coupled cluster (CC) methods.
As a viable alternative, we have proposed externally correcting the CC method using
the density matrix renormalization group (DMRG) wave functions, yielding the
DMRG-tailored CC method. In a previous paper [J. Chem. Phys. 2020, 152, 174107],
we reported a first implementation of this method in the relativistic context, which was
restricted to molecules with real double group symmetry. In this work, we present a
fully general implementation of the method, covering complex and quaternion double
groups as well. The 4c-TCC method thus becomes applicable to polyatomic molecules,
including heavy atoms. For the assessment of the method, we performed calculations of
the chiral uranium compound NUHFI, which was previously studied in the context of
the enhancement of parity violation effects. In particular, we performed calculations of a cut of the potential energy surface of this
molecule along the stretching of the N−U bond, where the system exhibits strong multireference character. Since there are no
experimental data for NUHFI, we have performed also an analogous study of the (more symmetric) NUF3 molecule, where the
vibrational frequency of the N−U bond can be compared with spectroscopic data.

abstract.en: A dataset supporting a published article entitled Large-Area Mechanically-Exfoliated Two-Dimensional Materials on Arbitrary Substrates. In this article, we present a method exploiting gold-assisted exfoliation to prepare large-area monolayers of various layered materials, followed by their transfer to arbitrary substrates, is presented. This technique is used to fabricate field-effect transistors and photodetectors to demonstrate the suitability its for large-area optoelectronic devices.

abstract.en: Formation of functional nanoscopic domains is an inherent property of plasma membranes. Stimulated emission depletion combined with fluorescence correlation spectroscopy (STED-FCS) has been used to identify such domains, however, the information obtained by STED-FCS has been limited to presence of such domains while crucial parameters have not been accessible, such as size, the fraction of occupied membrane surface, in-membrane lipid diffusion inside and outside the nanodomains as well as their self-diffusion. Here, based on a revision of the ‘diffusion law’, we present an approach to retrieve these five parameters from STED-FCS data. We verify that approach on ganglioside nanodomains in giant unilamellar vesicles (GUVs), validating the Saffman-Delbrück assumption for domain diffusion. We examined STED-FCS data in both plasma membranes of living PtK2 cells and in giant plasma membrane vesicles (GPMVs) and present a quantitative framework for molecular diffusion modes in biological membranes.

abstract.en:
Biogenic Volatile Organic Compounds (BVOC) emissions play an important role in atmospheric chemistry and ozone pollution. To assess their impact on air-pollution, regional chemistry transport models have to be applied that account for the transport, chemical transformation and deposition of pollutants. Here we present the results of CAMx simulations to quantify the impact of BVOC emissions on ozone (O3), formaldehyde (HCHO), hydroxyl radical (OH) and peroxy radicals near surface concentrations for central Europe over a decade-long period from 2007 to 2016. 

These data are the basis for the analysis presented by:
Liaskoni, M., Huszár, P., Bartík, L., Prieto Perez, A. P., Karlický, J., and Šindelářová, K.: The long-term impact of BVOC emissions on urban ozone patterns over central Europe: contributions from urban and rural vegetation, EGUsphere [preprint], https://doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-2027, 2024.  (check for final published version)

abstract.en:
This dataset contains the primary data related to the publication "Importance of Electron Correlation on the Geometry and Electronic Structure of [2Fe–2S] Systems: A Benchmark Study of the [Fe2S2(SCH3)4]2–,3–,4–, [Fe2S2(SCys)4]2–, [Fe2S2(S-p-tol)4]2–, and [Fe2S2(S-o-xyl)4]2– Complexes".
Specifically it contains files related to the portion of quantum chemical calculations which were carried out at the Heyrovsky Institute of Physical Chemistry.
Included are the input and output files for the Density Matrix Renormalization Group (DMRG) and Adiabatic Connection (AC) calculations of the FES Clusters, including 1 and 2 RDMs from the DMRG calculations.

abstract.en: FUME 2.0 - "Flexible Universal processor for Modeling Emissions" provides a flexible emission preprocessing tool for importing, interpolating, speciating and time-disaggregating various emission inventories to user defined spatial and temporal frames for chemistry transport model utilization (typically hourly data on a regular grid). Here, two user test cases are provided for the users: 1. "Czech" case covering the area of Czech republic that uses European and Czech emission repositories and  2. a "Prague" case for very high resolution (urban scale, street level) modelling.

abstract.en: The paper connected to this dataset briefly describes the optimization of MoNiCr alloy production for Generation IV reactor applications, focusing on additive manufacturing using the DED-LB process. Emphasis was placed on adjusting the chemical composition and input powder quality, which significantly influenced the final mechanical properties and minimised defects. A dataset (200 MB) is provided alongside the paper, including original metallographic images, tensile test results (Excel), flowability and PSD graphs (pdf), and an EDAX analysis (Word).

abstract.en: This paper examines the impact of PB on voter turnout in local, regional, and parliamentary elections in the Czech Republic. Using panel data from over 6,200 municipalities between 2009-2022, we employ ordinary least squares regression with fixed effects and an array of control variables to analyze the relationship between PB initiatives and electoral participation. Our findings reveal that PB has a significant and positive effect on voter turnout in local and regional elections, but we found no effect in parliamentary elections. Specifically, PB implementation is associated with a 2.8-3.9 percentage point increase in local election turnout and a 1.5-3.9 percentage point increase in regional election turnout when conducted within two years prior to elections. These effects are most pronounced when PB occurs one year before elections, the effect size and significance decrease with a longer time interval from the election. Our robustness check based on machine learning methods confirms these effects with generally similar magnitudes and significance. The lack of impact on parliamentary elections suggests that PB's influence is primarily localized, while local elections turnout may be fostered by the implementation of PB initiatives to enhance voter participation in local and regional democratic processes.

abstract.en:
Hydrophobic 7-phenylbutyl-7-deaadenine-modified DNA aptamers were selected against the Heat Shock Protein 70 via PEX and
magnetic bead-based SELEX. After 9 rounds of selection, the pool was sequenced and a number of candidates were identified.
Following initial screening, two modified aptamers were chemically synthesised in-house and their binding affinity analysed by
two methods, bio-layer interferometry and fluorescent-plate-based binding assay. The binding affinities of the modified
aptam,ers were compared with that of their natural counterparts. The resulting modified aptamers bound with higher affinity
(low nanomolar range) to the Hsp70 than their natural sequence (> 5 μM) and hence have potential for applications and further
development towards Hsp70 diagnostics or even therapeutics.

abstract.en: Raw image data from cell tracking experiments published in article "Role of casein kinase 1 (CK1) in the amoeboid migration of B cell leukemic and lymphoma cells" (https://doi.org/10.3389/fcell.2022.911966). We have tracked migration of 4 different cell lines originating from chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) in vitro under agarose confinement. We have tested the effects of biochemical and genetic attenuation of casein kinase 1 (CK1) signalling on the migration parameters. We have also tested positive stimulation by chemokines (CCL19 and CXCL12) together with VCAM1 coating in this setup to promote the migratory behaviour of the non-migratory cell lines. Finally, we attempted to quantify polarized localization of endocytic vesicles in MEC1 cells.

abstract.en: The data set contains the mass spectra used in the article, which evaluates the properties of water clusters produced by supersonic expansion. In particular, the binding energies of negative water clusters and energy which is deposited during the interactions with electrons of energies ranging from near zero to 70 eV. Besides the mass spectra of positively and negatively charged water clusters, the data set contains also ratios of metastable mass peaks to their parent peaks.

abstract.en: The data set underpins the Raman, resonance Raman (both including polarization-dependent measurements, also in the antiStokes region), photoluminescence, and optical absorption study of CrSBr crystals, a van der Waals, air-stable semiconductor material, showing its appealing intrinsic properties such as crystalline anisotropy, quasi-1D electronic characteristics, layer-dependent antiferromagnetism, and non-linear optical effects. The data show the differences between the absorption and emission spectra, focusing on the origin of the emission peak near 1.7 eV observed in the photoluminescence spectrum of CrSBr. Excitation-dependent Raman measurements in the relevant spectral region evidence the indirect nature of the 1.7 eV emission peak. The anti-Stokes Raman spectra show anomalously high anti-Stokes to Stokes intensity ratio of up to 0.8, which varies significantly with excitation laser power and crystallographic orientation relative to the polarization of the scattered light. Lastly, we examine stimulated Raman scattering (with a continuous 1.96 eV laser excitation) for the A2 Raman mode and calculate the Raman gain in CrSBr, which attains a value of 1 × 10<sup>8</sup> cm/GW, nearly four orders of magnitude higher than that of previously studied three-dimensional systems.

abstract.en: The interleaflet transport of phospholipids is a crucial physiological process in the cell plasma membrane. This process can be facilitated by specific proteins—scramblases—without ATP consumption. The experimental data provided here describe the lipid scrambling activity of the Sec61/TRAP translocon, a protein complex previously known for facilitating the membrane translocation of nascent polypeptide chains. In this study, we reconstituted Sec61/TRAP into large unilamellar vesicles and employed two complementary fluorescence-based assays—NBD fluorescence quenching by bovine serum albumin and sodium dithionite—to investigate its scrambling activity. Both approaches confirmed that Sec61/TRAP facilitates lipid scrambling. Notably, blocking the Sec61 translocation cavity did not inhibit scrambling, suggesting the presence of an alternative lipid transport pathway within the translocon complex.

abstract.en:
Objectives: The research aims to prepare the basis for targeted educational activities to increase awareness of IHD risk factors in middle-aged adult populations.
Methods: A cross-sectional study. A combination of a non-standard questionnaire dealing with stable ischemic heart disease and a standardized health literacy questionnaire (HLSQ-16) was used for data collection. The sample of citizens was a quota sample; its structure corresponded to the composition of all citizens of the Czech Republic in terms of gender, age, and region. It comprised 1,391 respondents.
Results: 66.9% of respondents answered that they knew heart disease risk factors. A significant correlation was identified between sex and the knowledge of risk factors of heart diseases (p=0.015), risk factors of high cholesterol (p=0.036), coffee (p=0.012), and contraception (p=0.000). In respondents taking part in regular physical examinations, a significant correlation was identified concerning the opinions of obesity (p=0.001), hypertension (p =0.004), heredity (p=0.000), immunity disorders (p=0.036), high cholesterol levels (p =0.003), coffee (p=0.011), hormonal contraception (p=0.001), smoking (p=0.000), stress (p=0.000), diabetes (p=0.005) as risk factors of heart disease. The population with a higher productive age (40 – 64 years) is homogeneous.
Conclusion: Based on this study, targeted educational activities for the 40-64 age group can be recommended to address specific risk factors and attitudes in this category. The study showed a satisfactory awareness of IHD risk factors in the population. However, there is room for improvement, especially in the 40-64 age group.

abstract.en:
The rate coefficients and product ion branching ratio of the reactions of H3O+, NO+, O2+•, OH-,O2-•, O-•, NO2-, and NO3- with selected representative polyfluoroalkyl (PFAS) molecules: one fluorocarbon (perfluoro-2-methyl-2-pentene), five acids (pentafluoropropionic, heptafluorobutyric, nonafluorobutane-1-sulfonic, perfluorohexanoic, and perfluoro(2-methyl-3-oxahexanoic) acids) and two alcohols (nonafluoro-1-hexanol and tridecafluoro-1-octanol). The experiments were conducted using a selected ion flow tube (SIFT), the Voice200, in N2 at 393 K under dry and humid conditions. The raw data are organised into two main folders, each named according to the specific condition. Within these folders, data for each specific compound are consolidated into a single file. Each file contains:

w  A peak table with raw data spectra for all reagents reacting with the specific compound. 

w  Two Excel files: one detailing the branching ratios and the other containing the rate coefficients.

w  PDF.

abstract.en:
Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations were performed using the B3LYP functional with the 6-311++G(d,p) basis set and D4 dispersion correction to study neutral and protonated structures of aldehydes. Geometry optimisations were carried out for all neutral molecules and bent protonated ions. Thermodynamic properties such as enthalpy (H), entropy (S), and Gibbs free energy (G) were calculated for each optimised structure, and the respective ΔH, ΔS, and ΔG values were at 298.15 K.

 

The dataset includes ORCA output files containing charge distributions and thermodynamic data. All data are organised in a single file, each named according to the compound and its geometry (neutral or protonated).

abstract.en:
The kinetics of the reactions of H3O+, NO+, O2+• and O-• with n-hexane, 3-methylpentane, 2,5-dimethylhexane and 2,3-dimethylheptane were studied experimentally under several selected ion flow tube (SIFT) conditions: in a Profile 3 instrument in He and N2 at 300 K and in the Voice200 instrument N2 at 300 and 393 K – at extraction lens voltage 7V and 4V.

The Voice200 data are organised in Excel files named according to the compounds. The file names also indicate the temperature and the extraction lens voltage. In each file, there are sheets for different reagent ions containing the count rates of ions recorded at different times and different mass to charge ratios (indicated as mz columns). The branching ratios and the rate coefficients are given on separate sheets.

 The Profile 3 data are organised in a single file for all compounds.

abstract.en:
This is a dataset supporting the published article on the mechanisms of 
metal-assisted exfoliation of large-area monolayer MoS2. Metal-assisted 
exfoliation has emerged as an effective approach for producing 
large-area monolayers of two-dimensional materials, with gold-assisted 
exfoliation being one of the most successful examples. While other 
metals also show promise for enabling large-area exfoliation, their 
wider application is often limited by oxidation in air. In this study, 
monolayer MoS2 heterostructures were fabricated on polycrystalline gold, 
silver, copper, palladium, cobalt, and nickel via direct mechanical 
exfoliation of bulk molybdenite under controlled atmospheric conditions. 
The dataset contains the complete set of results used in the 
publication, including density functional theory (DFT) calculations, 
Raman spectroscopy, photoelectron spectroscopies (XPS, UPS), and atomic 
force microscopy (AFM) maps. These combined experimental and 
computational results reveal that the exfoliation efficiency depends 
strongly on the choice of metal substrate. In particular, the 
hybridization directionality and the asymmetry between the bottom and 
top sulfur atoms in MoS2 are identified as key factors that weaken 
MoS2–MoS2 van der Waals interactions. This weakening at the first 
interface enables selective monolayer exfoliation, providing new 
insights into the design of substrate–material systems for scalable 
production of high-quality two-dimensional crystals.

abstract.en:
This is a dataset supporting a published article "Strain-Induced Decoupling Drives Gold-Assisted Exfoliation of Large-Area Monolayer 2D Crystals".
Gold-assisted exfoliation (GAE) is a groundbreaking mechanical exfoliation technique that produces centimeter-scale single-crystal monolayers of 2D materials. Such large, high-quality films offer unparalleled advantages over the micron-sized flakes typically produced by conventional exfoliation techniques, significantly accelerating the research and technological advancements in the field of 2D materials. Despite its wide applications, the fundamental mechanism of GAE remains poorly understood. In this study,
using MoS2 on Au as a model system, ultra-low frequency Raman spectroscopy is employed to elucidate how the interlayer interactions within MoS2 crystals are impacted by the gold substrate. The results reveal that the coupling at the first MoS2-MoS2 interface between the adhered layer on the gold substrate and the adjacent layer is substantially weakened, with the binding force being reduced to nearly zero. This renders the first interface the weakest point in the system, thereby the crystal preferentially cleaves at this junction, generating large-area monolayers with sizes comparable to the parent crystal. Biaxial strain in the adhered layer, induced by the gold substrate, is identified as the driving factor for the decoupling effect. The strain-induced decoupling effect is established as the primary mechanism of GAE, which can also play a significant role in general mechanical exfoliations.

_files.key: A method for determination of transport efficiency in laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry for tissue analysis.zip
_files.name: A method for determination of transport efficiency in laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry for tissue analysis.zip

abstract.en: Recent studies have demonstrated the applicability of the “single particle” mode in laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry to map and size particles simultaneously. The transport efficiency (TE) is an important parameter in this configuration and affects the detection of individual nanoparticles, reliability of nanoparticle characterization, and related applications. This study introduces a novel method for the precise determination of TE, based on counting upconversion nanoparticles from gels characterized by fluorescent microscopy. The method was found to be most suitable for the 2940 nm laser ablation system, achieving virtually quantitative nanoparticle desorption, with TE primarily governed by ablation cell design and aerosol transport efficiency. With the 213 nm laser, attention had to be paid to incomplete desorption and possible nanoparticle redeposition at low laser fluences to avoid variability in TE measurements. Finally, use of the 193 nm laser induced nanoparticle disintegration, resulting in elevated baseline noise and lower sensitivity, which prevented the use of this approach for the determination of TE. This study highlights the versatility of the proposed method, while also identifying its limitations in terms of wavelength and fluence.

_files.key: Mass measurement and separation of large unilamellar vesicles in SELINA instrument.zip
_files.name: Mass measurement and separation of large unilamellar vesicles in SELINA instrument.zip

abstract.en:
‘Sample 1’, ‘Sample 2’ and ‘Sample 3’ are folders with data for latex beads (300 nm diameter) and large unilamellar POPC vesicles 
(nominal 200 nm diameter), which were electrosprayed (100 mM ammonium acetate water, +1.2 kV, 1.5-2 mm distance) and 
measured by Selected Ice Nanoparticle Accelerator (SELINA). Charge detector was used to record time transient of the amplified 
induced charge when a particle moves through the metal 5 cm pick-up tube of the charge detector. These transients were 
recorded as the MATLAB compressed MAT files (‘beads non-resolving’, ‘vesicles non-resolving’, ‘vesicles resolving’ folders). The 
raw data were processed to obtain m/z, charge and mass from each valid transient signal and are collected in corresponding CSV
files: ‘beads non-resolving.csv’, ‘vesicles non-resolving.csv’, ‘vesicles resolving.csv’. The excel file ‘Application records’ contains 
data from processed transient signals within the software online, used mainly for the SELINA instrument operation and 
monitoring during the experiments, see Table 1 for details in README. There are also Python code files with examples for data processing.

abstract.en: This dataset supports the published article titled “Structural and Chemical Changes in Si Nanoparticle-Based Anodes in Lithium-Ion Batteries during the (De)lithiation Processes Studied by In Situ Raman Spectroelectrochemistry.” It contains in situ Raman spectroelectrochemical data, as well as data from cyclic voltammetry and galvanostatic charge/discharge measurements of silicon anodes prepared from 6 nm Si nanoparticles. The in situ Raman SEC provides unique insight into the crystal lattice changes and degradation/amorphization pathways of the Si nanocrystals and the electrolyte (LiPF6 in EC/DMC) decomposition during the electrochemical lithiation and delithiation processes. The evolution of the spectral parameters (shift, line width, intensity) of the first-order Raman peak of crystalline Si at 520 cm–1 is found to be related to the stress buildup in the nanoparticles. This stress originates from the (i) SEI layer formation on the electrode surface within the initial charge/discharge cycle, (ii) the lithiation-induced stress in Si nanoparticles and the native oxide on their surface, and also (iii) the progressive crystalline-to-amorphous Si phase transition. The structural changes in the anodes determined using in situ Raman SEC show good agreement with the results obtained from cyclic voltammetry measurements, revealing a progressive crystalline-to-amorphous Si phase transition and a complex energy storage mechanism in nanostructured silicon anodes in LIBs.

abstract.en: The interleaflet transport of phospholipids is a crucial physiological process in the cell plasma membrane. This process can be facilitated by specific proteins—scramblases—without ATP consumption. We designed experiments, testing lipid scrambling activity of the Sec61/TRAP translocon, a protein complex previously known for facilitating the membrane translocation of nascent polypeptide chains. To investigate such an activity, we employed experiments based on NBD fluorescence quenching. Employment of these experiments requires reconstitution of Sec61/TRAP in large unilamellar vesicles. Here are provided data, controlling the polydispersity index (PDI) and distribution of hydrodynamic diameter of the LUVs before and after the reconstitution procedure, determined by Dynamic Light Scattering (DLS)

abstract.en: The uploaded files contain initial conditions and other parameters to perform classical molecular dynamics simulations of uptake of alcohols on aqueous nitric acid clusters. These simulations complemented experimental data in the to-be-submitted publication and enabled their interpretation. Results of the joint project have implications for modelling of new particle formation in the atmosphere.

<![endif]--><a name="_Hlk182320168"><span lang="DE" style="font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:150%;font-family:
"Myriad Pro",sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:DE;mso-fareast-language:JA;mso-bidi-language:
AR-SA">This dataset describes data for study of the electronic properties of molecules for molecular electronics. Functional molecular electronics require molecular design that provides
integrity and stability. In this work, we explored two types of single molecule
devices differing in anchoring to the conducting leads. Single molecule
conductance was measured by STM break junction method and the molecular
conductor was composed of the redox active anthraquinone center (switching
element) containing either 4-pyridyl or <i style="mso-bidi-font-style:normal">p</i>-phenylene
thioacetate anchoring groups. The experimental results were supported by
quantum chemical charge transport calculations. Molecular junctions containing
4-pyridyl anchors displayed two stable configurations with conductance values
of 4.9 nS and 20 pS, respectively. Molecules anchored via <i style="mso-bidi-font-style:normal">p</i>-phenylene thioacetate groups led to one
main junction configuration with conductance of 0.1 nS. Junctions
employing 4-pyridyl anchoring groups had higher junction formation probability,
which in combination with lower conductance makes them better candidates for
switching purposes.</span></a>

abstract.en:
This is a dataset supporting a published paper Interface and Morphology Engineered Amorphous Si for Ultrafast Electrochemical Lithium Storage. Ultrafast high-capacity lithium-ion batteries are extremely desirable 
for portable electronic devices, where Si is the most promising 
alternative to the conventional graphite anode due to its very high 
theoretical capacity. However, the low electronic conductivity and poor 
Li-diffusivity limit its rate capability. Moreover, high volume 
expansion/contraction upon Li-intake/uptake causes severe pulverization 
of the electrode, leading to drastic capacity fading. Here, interface 
and morphology-engineered amorphous Si matrix is being reported 
utilizing a few-layer vertical graphene (VG) buffer layer to retain high
 capacity at both slow and fast (dis)charging rates. The flexible 
mechanical support of VG due to the van-der-Waals interaction between 
the graphene layers, the weak adhesion between Si and graphene, and the 
highly porous geometry mitigated stress, while the three-dimensional 
mass loading enhanced specific capacity. Additionally, the high 
electronic conductivity of VG boosted rate-capability, resulting in a 
reversible gravimetric capacity of ≈1270 mAh g<sup>−1</sup> (areal capacity of ≈37 µAh cm<sup>−2</sup>)
 even after 100 cycles at an ultrafast cycling rate of 20C, which 
provides a fascinating way for conductivity and stress management to 
obtain high-performance storage devices.

abstract.en:
Understanding the dynamics and persistence of biodiversity patterns over short (present) and long (thousands of years) time scales is crucial for predicting ecosystem changes under global climate and land-use changes. A key challenge is integrating currently scattered ecological data to assess complex vegetation dynamics over time. Here, we present VegVault, an interdisciplinary SQLite database that uniquely integrates paleo- and neo-ecological plot-based vegetation data on a global and millennial scale, directly linking them with functional traits, soil, and climate information. VegVault currently comprises data from BIEN, sPlotOpen, TRY, Neotoma, CHELSA, and WoSIS, providing a comprehensive and ready-to-use resource for researchers across various fields to address questions about past and contemporary biodiversity patterns and their abiotic drivers.To further support usability of the data, VegVault is complemented by the {vaultkeepr} R package, enabling streamlined data access, extraction, and manipulation. This study introduces the structure, content, and diverse applications of VegVault, emphasizing its role in advancing ecological research to improve predictions of biodiversity responses to global climate change.

More details on project website.

abstract.en: This is a dataset supporting a published paper "Mechanical response of monolayer graphene via a multi-probe approach". Push-to-pull (PTP) testing is employed to probe the uniaxial tensile response of freestanding monolayer graphene. Various analytical approaches are employed to estimate the elastic modulus of end-clamped graphene samples, combining in-situ Raman spectroscopy and scanning electronic microscope (SEM) measurements. The utilization of spatially resolved Raman-derived strains for assessing the elastic properties of monolayer graphene leads to results consistent with previous experimental and theoretical values of the elastic modulus (approximately 1 TPa). Molecular dynamics (MD) simulations of (pristine and defective) freestanding graphene sheets uniaxially loaded under varying clamping conditions are performed to support the experimental observations. The computational results indicate that the mechanical responses of the sheets are affected by the type, the spatial profile, and the heterogeneity of the clamping. When uniaxial pulling of end-clamped graphene is applied by a substrate adhering to the graphene sheet through van der Waals forces (as in PTP testing), the elastic modulus may be highly underestimated due to often inhomogeneous stress distribution and slippage processes. The MD simulations predict that the elastic modulus of pristine monolayer graphene is approximately 1 TPa, whereas its fracture strength can reach values of up to 110 GPa. Overall, this study underscores the limitations of traditional analyses of PTP experiments (utilizing indentation readouts and SEM imaging) and proposes new potential avenues (involving Raman measurements) for future research on the elastic properties of 2D materials.

abstract.en: Activated borane (ActB), a metal- and halogen-free porous borane cluster polymer with a significant Lewis acidity, has been successfully used as a heterogeneous catalyst for hydrodehalogenation reactions of aliphatic fluorides and chlorides using triethylsilane as a reductant. In analogy to known homogeneous systems, full dehalogenation of organohalides is achieved with a predominant formation of Friedel–Crafts alkylation products in aromatic reaction media. Importantly, the herein described material is robust, tolerates elevated reaction temperatures and can be re-used, while reaching a turnover number (TON) of up to 5190. These features make it an attractive candidate for a sustainable disposal of halogenated pollutants by heterogeneous catalysis.

abstract.en:
Supporting data for the article titled Design and characterization of the setup for electron-ion trapping experiments.
Abstract of the article:
This work presents the Electron-Ion Trap Experiment (EiTEx), a setup designed for microwave detection and the co-trapping of electrons and ions within the same region. EiTEx utilizes a custom-made dual-frequency Paul trap, leveraging Coulomb interactions to achieve efficient electron cooling and radio-frequency photon detection by monitoring changes in the spectral signature of the electron-ion compound quantum system. The system integrates 3D-printed ultrahigh vacuum-compatible high-quality microwave resonator and a neutral atom source, and a simple yet cost-effective optical system for imaging of ion Coulomb crystals. By enabling co-trapping of ions and electrons, EiTEx provides a robust platform for microwave detection and the exploration of electron-ion interactions, paving the way for future advancements in quantum sensing technologies.

<p class="Default" style="text-align:justify">The influence and specific
interactions of chemical modifications in the DNA major groove have been
systematically investigated for a long time, being useful in many applications.
<span lang="EN-GB" style="mso-ansi-language:EN-GB">The standard sub-nanomolar
quantities of enzymatically synthesized base-modified ONs or DNAs are usually
not sufficient for structural determination by NMR or X-ray analyses and hence
the structures of base-modified DNAs have not been systematically studied. To
fill this gap in the enzymatic methodology for large-scale synthesis of
base-modified DNA, we present here the scalable </span>enzymatic synthesis of base-modified
DNA in milligram scale. For this synthesis, four 2´-deoxyribonucleoside
triphosphates bearing an electron-rich phenyl group at position 7 of
7-deazapurines and at position 5 of pyrimidines (<b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">dN<sup>Ph</sup>TP</b>s, N=<b>A</b><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold">, <b>G</b>, <b>C</b>, <b>U</b></span>) were prepared according to
published procedures and used in primer extension (PEX) and polymerase chain
reaction (PCR) experiments with in-house expressed KOD(exo-) DNA polymerase. All
four modified <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">dN<sup>Ph</sup>TP</b>s
served as good substrates in PEX providing phenyl-modified dsDNA in a milligram-quantities
sufficient for extended structural studies (Tm, CD, MALDI-TOF), focusing mainly
on proper NMR structural determination supported by additional molecular dynamics
simulations. The main goal is particularly to understand the various biological
processes and bioorthogonal reactions of macromolecules.</p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify">A series of adenosine
triphosphate derivatives bearing chloro, fluoro, amino, methyl, vinyl and
ethynyl groups at position 2 were synthesized and tested as substrates for RNA
and DNA polymerases. The modified nucleotides worked well in <i>in vitro</i>
transcription with T7 RNA polymerase and primer extension (PEX) using
engineered DNA polymerases (TGK, 2M) except for the bulkier 2-vinyl- and
2-ethynyl-ATP derivatives that gave truncated products. However, in single
nucleotide incorporation followed by PEX they still could be used for
site-specific incorporation of reactive modifications into RNA that could be
further used for post-synthetic labelling through thiol-ene or CuAAC reactions.
All modified ATPs worked in polyadenylation catalyzed by <span style="mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:150%">poly(A) polymerase (ScPAP)
to form long 3’-polyA tails containing the modifications that also can be used
for labelling.</span></p>

abstract.en: We have designed and synthesized a series of uracil 2ʹ-deoxyribonucleosides and 5ʹ-O- triphosphates (dNTPs) bearing diverse modifications at position 5. These included rare natural nucleotides occurring in some bacteriophages, i.e. α-putrescinylthymine, α-glutaminylthymine, 5-dihydroxypentyluracil, and methylated or non-methylated 5-aminomethyluracil, and related non-natural 5-sulfanylmethyl- and 5-cyanomethyluracil. Most of the dNTPs bearing basic substituents were moderate to poor substrates for DNA polymerases, but still useful in primer extension synthesis of modified DNA. Together with previously reported 5-hydroxymethyl, 5-hydroxyethyl, 5-ethyl and 5-acetylpyrimidine nucleotides, they were used for synthesis of diverse DNA templates modified in the sense or antisense of the promoter region and some of them also for templates modified in both strands. A systematic study of the in vitro transcription with T7 RNA polymerase showed a moderate positive effect of most of the uracil modifications in the non-template (sense) strand and some either positive or negative influence of modifications in the template (antisense) strand. The most interesting modification was the non-natural 5-cyanomethyluracil which showed significant positive effect in in vitro transcription.

abstract.en: Molecular dynamics simulations trajectories of microtubule in an intense electric field. Four electric field directions, two different field strengths, two different temperatures, and three different ion concentrations were explored. The data can serve further to researchers in the field of bionanotechnology, bioelectromagnetics and biophysics.

abstract.en:
New voltammetric and flow amperometric methods for the determination of guaifenesin (GFE) using a
perspective screen-printed sensor (SPE) with boron-doped diamond electrode (BDDE) were developed. The
electrochemical oxidation of GFE was studied on the surface of the oxygen-terminated BDDE of the sensor. The
GFE provided two irreversible anodic signals at a potential of 1.0 and 1.1 V (vs. Ag|AgCl|KCl sat.) in Britton-
Robinson buffer (pH 2), which was chosen as the supporting electrolyte for all measurements. First, a voltammetric
method based on differential pulse voltammetry was developed and a low detection limit (LOD = 41
nmol L- 1), a wide linear dynamic range (LDR = 0.1–155 μmol L- 1), and a good recovery in the analysis of model
and pharmaceutical samples (RSD <3.0 %) were obtained. In addition, this sensor demonstrated excellent
sensitivity and reproducibility in the analysis of biological samples (RSD <3.2 %), where the analysis took place
in a drop of serum (50 μL) without pretreatment and additional electrolyte. Subsequently, SP/BDDE was
incorporated into a flow-through 3D printed electrochemical cell and a flow injection analysis method with
electrochemical detection (FIA-ED) was developed, resulting in excellent analytical parameters (LOD = 86 nmol
L- 1, LDR = 0.1–50 μmol L- 1). Moreover, the mechanism of electrochemical oxidation of GFE was proposed based
on calculations of HOMO spatial distribution and spectroelectrochemical measurements focused on IR identification
of intermediates and products.

abstract.en: This dataset contains experimental data from a dissociative electron attachment (DEA) study of the CH3I molecule. The experiment was performed primarily using the dissociative electron attachment - velocity map imaging (DEA-VMI) experimental setup. In addition, the Cluster Beam (CLUB) apparatus was also employed to obtain high resolution mass spectra. Using the DEA-VMI setup, we measured the anionic mass spectra of CH3I produced due to DEA. Then we measured the ion-yield curves of I- and CH2- fragments. We also measured the high-resolution mass spectra at 8.0 eV incident electron beam energy using the CLUB setup. Velocity Map Images (VMI) of I- fragments were measured using the DEA-VMI setup at 0.01, 0.06, 0.1, and 8.0 eV incident electron energies. The angular distribution and kinetic energy distribution of the I- fragments were obtained from the VMI data. The data set also contained the simulated velocity map image of I- fragments based on measured kinetic energy distribution.

abstract.en: Formation of functional nanoscopic domains is an inherent property of plasma membranes. Stimulated emission depletion combined with fluorescence correlation spectroscopy (STED-FCS) has been used to identify such domains, however, the information obtained by STED-FCS has been limited to presence of such domains while crucial parameters have not been accessible, such as size, the fraction of occupied membrane surface, in-membrane lipid diffusion inside and outside the nanodomains as well as their self-diffusion. Here, based on a revision of the ‘diffusion law’, we present an approach to retrieve these five parameters from STED-FCS data. We verify that approach on ganglioside nanodomains in giant unilamellar vesicles (GUVs), validating the Saffman-Delbrück assumption for domain diffusion. We examined STED-FCS data in both plasma membranes of living PtK2 cells and in giant plasma membrane vesicles (GPMVs) and present a quantitative framework for molecular diffusion modes in biological membranes.

abstract.en:
We analyze the structures, stabilities, and thermo-
chemical properties of polyethylene (PE) oligomer chains cross-
linked by metal (M) atoms through C−M−C bonds. Representa-
tive PEn−Mm−PEn complexes contain between 7 and 15 carbon
atoms in each oligomer and one to three Li, Be, Mg, Zn, Ag, or Au
cross-linking metal elements. PEn−Mm−PEn complexes are
quasiplanar with nearly parallel PE chains. Their stability is
determined by covalent C−M−C bonds accompanied by non-
covalent dispersion interactions between PEn chains. Using the
CAM-B3LYP+D3BJ+ABC functional, the binding energies of
PE15−M−PE15 with respect to two PE15 radicals and metal
fragments are −225, −230, −322, −551, −289, and −303 kJ/mol
for Li, Ag, Au, Be, Mg, and Zn atoms, respectively. Entropy contributions (109 to 121 kJ/mol at 298.15 K) destabilize all complexes
significantly. With two cross-linking metal elements in PE15−M2−PE15 complexes, binding energies are about double. Complexes
with several open-shell Li, Ag, or Au doublet atoms have spins located on separated C−M−C bonds. High-spin PE15−Mm1−PE15−
Mm2−PE15 complexes of three PE oligomers cross-linked by up to five doublet metal atoms create parallel PE tubes, which are
suggested as elementary cells for modeling magnetic polymer tubes.

abstract.en: Here, we present VegVault (v1.0.0), an interdisciplinary SQLite database that uniquely integrates paleo- and neo-ecological plot-based vegetation data on a global and millennial scale, directly linking them with functional traits, soil, and climate information. VegVault (v1.0.0) currently comprises data from BIEN, sPlotOpen, TRY, Neotoma, CHELSA, and WoSIS, providing a comprehensive and ready-to-use resource for researchers across various fields to address questions about past and contemporary biodiversity patterns and their abiotic drivers. More details on the project website (https://bit.ly/VegVault).

abstract.en: The dataset contains proteins from AlphaFold DB (v4) encoded into one-dimensional vectors (embeddings), representing proteins based on their tertiary structure (the three-dimensional arrangement of the protein's amino acid chain). These embeddings are created using the 3D Zernike Descriptor (3DZD) method and capture information about the protein's 3D structure. Each protein is represented as a fixed-length vector of size 120. This vector representation allows for efficient computational analysis and comparison of proteins, bypassing the need for complex 3D structure alignment algorithms. The embeddings can be used for various bioinformatics tasks, including protein function prediction, structural similarity searches, protein-protein interaction prediction, and evolutionary relationship analysis. While powerful, these embeddings may not capture all aspects of protein function and may have biases based on the training data and methods used. Researchers and developers can leverage these embeddings for rapid protein analysis, drug discovery, and other computational biology applications, making them a valuable resource in the field of bioinformatics. These embeddings were created to be used in an efficient similarity search engine -- AlphaFind.

abstract.en: A dataset supporting a published article entitled Electrostatic Gating of Monolayer Graphene by Concentrated Aqueous Electrolytes on Arbitrary Substrates. In this article, we study electrostatic gating of monolayer graphene using different aqueous electrolyte solutions. We find that while the initial doping state of graphene is affected by the type and concentration of the electrolyte, the rate of the doping of graphene with applied voltage, measured using in-situ Raman spectroelectrochemistry, is nearly constant. Furthermore, we compare different gating systems and show that the gating efficiency depends strongly on the gate capacitance, dropping as low as 70% for common electrolytes and applied voltage, and as low as 6% for common dielectric gates
